intro: Deidamia clematoides, commonly known as the creeping clematis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves that are typically hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to the eastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
